title: Wrong Way to Reject a Judge Rejecting the advice of New York's Senators, the Reagan Administration has refused to nominate Will Hellerstein, a highly regarded lawyer, to a Federal judgeship. Though this violates custom, it is the President's prerogative. But the case was handled so crudely that it raises questions about the Administration's hidden agenda.
